backend/main.mo: Empty Motoko actor with no methods.
feature_evidence.json: Feature report listing two frontend tasks about removing pig plushie images and asset references.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Text file containing prewritten summaries of various frontend components and config files.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base styles defining theme variables for light/dark modes with Valentine‑themed colors.
frontend/index.html: Basic HTML shell loading the React app via main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main React component managing question/yes/no view state within a themed layout.
frontend/src/components/valentine/Celebr: Generates floating animated heart icons for the yes‑state celebration.
frontend/src/components/valentine/Person: Empty component file with no implementation.
frontend/src/components/valentine/Valent: Layout wrapper providing a background image, gradient, and overlay for Valentine UI pages.
Displays the 'No' response card with gentle messaging and a button to return.
Main question card with decorative images, message text, and Yes/Maybe buttons.
'Yes' celebration card with animated hearts and a back button.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React hook creating and updating an authenticated or anonymous backend actor using React Query.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides a React context and provider for managing Internet Identity login state using AuthClient, exposing identity, login, logout, and status flags.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Empty placeholder file indicating no backend queries are used and all state is client‑side.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines Tailwind base styles, Valentine-themed color variables, fonts, focus styles, and custom heart animations.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app, wrapping it with React Query and the Internet Identity provider.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Configures Tailwind theme extensions including typography, colors tied to CSS variables, animations, and dark mode settings.
project_state.json: Stores project metadata, existing features, requirements links, and architectural notes for the Valentine’s Day site.
